quotes.quote: Give me a treat, or leave me alone. It's Monday
Mondays are mundane, like Tuesdays minus 24 hours.
What we do on Sunday absolutely doesn't matter unless it meets us on Monday. Changes us on Monday. Transforms us on Monday.
Hey I know it's Monday but it's also a new day, a new week, and in that lies a new opportunity for something special to happen.
Every Monday morning is new hope.
The biggest thrill wasn't in winning on Sunday but in meeting the payroll on Monday.
Monday is an awful way to spend 1/7 of your life.
Imagine having Mondays as a holiday and then it wold be the best thing. Will someone please assist me in making it a official holiday and solve all our Monday blues.
Employers are at their happiest on Mondays. Employees are at their happiest on Fridays.
Mondays are the start of the work week which offer new beginnings 52 times a year!
What about Monday- That could be our one day we look at things the same way, and wear funny shoes.
Don't let a day of the week have so much power over your happiness. Monday.
Mondays are a good day to make statements, not Friday.
There is nothing more dreadful than having to go walking on one's own on Monday.
It was a strangely disorienting feeling, to have something you'd relied on for so long start to change, like finding out that gravity no longer worked on Mondays.
Don't mess with anybody on a Monday. It's a bad, bad day.
If only one of the presidential candidates would make it part of his platform to do something about making Monday part of the weekend. I think he would get a lot of votes.
Mondays are a lot like getting fat. They make you feel sad, sometimes angry and there is not much scope for liking either fat or Mondays for any reason.
Monday is the day of silence, day of the whole white mung bean, which is sacred to the moon.
Sometimes it pays to stay in bed in Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
All men tend to become angry and irritated on the start of the week. It is the start of the week but is the end of all fun and happiness in life.
Even the best weeks start with monday
On Monday mornings I am dedicated to the proposition that all men are created jerks.
This has been such a Monday! I wish I stayed in bed, and I wish that yesterday had never happened.
Monday is a great for becoming too busy to die.
There are no miracles on Mondays.
If each day is a gift, I would like to know where I can return Mondays.
On Monday, when the sun is hot, I wonder to myself a lot. Now is it true, or is it not, that what is which and which is what?
Work in a way that you look forward to Monday mornings
You don't want to have to come into work on Monday already apologizing. I try to save my apologies for what I've done later in the week.
Candy is natures way of making up for Mondays.
Don't let the Monday morning quarterbacks stop you from being bold. You've got to set a high bar.
Monday morning you sure look fine.
Believe on Monday the way you believe on Sunday.
Monday, Monday, so good to me; Monday morning, it was all I hoped it would be.
So. Monday. We meet again. We will never be friends—but maybe we can move past our mutual enmity toward a more-positive partnership.
I must break the routines and become a person who becomes productive every Monday. I must break the mindset of unhappiness and turn myself into a happy magnet for Mondays.
Okay, it's Monday but who said Mondays have to suck? Be a rebel and have a great day anyway.
You are in control. Never allow your Monday to be manic.
Find a job you like and you will add five days to every week.
Monday is great if I can spend it in bed. I’m a man of simple pleasures, really.
Last Monday nite / I saw a fight / Between Wednesday and Thursday / Over Saturday nite / Tuesday asked me what was going on / I said "Sunday's in the meadow / And Friday's in the corn".

It is a custom in Ireland, among shoemakers, if they intoxicate themselves on Sunday, to do no work on Monday; and this they call making a Saint Monday or keeping Saint Crispin's day. Many here adopted this good custom from the example of the shoemakers.
Monday, n. In Christian countries, the day after the baseball game.
"As Monday goes, so goes the week," dames say. Refreshed, renewed, use well the initial day. And see! thy neighbour already seeks his labour.
Red beans were traditionally cooked while the Monday wash was drying on the line, and since New Orleans humidity made that an all-day job, the beans cooked for many hours.
It's just another manic Monday / I wish it was Sunday / 'Cause that's my fun day / My I don't have to run day.
To Banbury came I, O profane one! / Where I saw a Puritane-one / Hanging of his cat on Monday / For killing of a mouse on Sunday.
My good man, Crillon, hang yourself for not having been at my side last Monday at the greatest event that's ever been seen and perhaps ever will be seen.
You know you're getting older when every day seems like Monday.
He who is not tipsy on Sunday is not worth shaking hands with on Monday.
Mondays are the potholes in the road of life.
When life gives you Monday, dip it in glitter and sparkle all day.
Let me ask you something. When you come in on Monday and you're not feeling real well, does anyone ever say to you, "Sounds like someone has a case of the Mondays?"
Beautiful. Relaxed. But always in the back of your mind, there's the knowledge that it'll soon be Monday. There's no future in being a Sunday-night girl.

quotes.cite: John Adams with Dr. Benjamin Franklin and Thomas Jefferson
quotes.quote: We're waiting for the chirp, chirp, chirp, of an eaglet being born, / Waiting for the chirp, chirp, chirp, on this humid Monday morning, in this... / Congressional incubator.

Monday is a funny thing / Still waiting for the phone to ring / Will my imagination take it slow / After Saturday, my life is changed / In a moment it was rearranged / Strange how easy it is letting go / And I miss your face / Like the sun was in my eyes / And now I'm running blind.
You brought your Sunday morning sunshine / Here into my Monday morning rain. / You taught me happiness just one time, / It keeps on coming back again.
Easter Monday in the city - / Rattle, rattle, rumble, rush; / Tom and Jerry, Nell and Kitty, / All the down-the-harbour “push,” / Little thought have they, or pity, / For a wanderer from the bush.
